original: Jung, Karl Torsten Fredrik, direktör, Jönköping, f. 28/5/80 i Malmö av rektor Victor J. o. Maria Levan. G. 07 m. Gärda Lyttkens. Barn: Erland f. 08, övering., Linköp., Ingvar 10, över-ing., Finspång, Bertil 15, marinimg., Karlskr., Arme 18, kapt. v. Flygv., Norrköp. — Mog:ex. i Hälsdngb. 97, KTH (M) 99-01. Föret, ett flert. res. t. USA m. fl. länder. Bitr. ing. o. byråing. v. Patent- o. reg:verket 01-14, anst. v. A-B Diesels Motorer 02-03, assist, v. KTH 03-13, tf. lektor i läran om maskinelement där 07-08, tf. prof. i maskinlära 12, överlär. i mek. o. maskinlära v. tekn. sk. i Sthlm 06-13, övering. v. A-B Fören. Sv. Tändsticks-fabr. 13-33, verkst. dir. där ’Sed. 33, dito i Jönköp. & Vulcans Tändsticks-fabr. A-B sed. 29. Led. av styr. f. sistnämnda föret. o. Sv. Accum. A-B Jungner, ordf. i styr. f. Sv. Vaxduks A-B o. i styr. f. Försäkr. A-B Allni. Brand sed. 46, led. av stadsfullm. o. drätselkamm. i Kalmar 17-21, ordf. i Smål. o. Blek. hand :kamm. sed. 37. Pat. å ett flert. uppfinn., betr. bl. a. automat. fart- o. distansavgivn. (SAL-loggen) f. fartyg. KV02kl, RNO, Idr:GM, SkytteGM.
translated: Jung, Karl Torsten Fredrik, director, Jönköping, born May 28th, 1880 in Malmö to principal Victor J. and Maria Levan. Married in 1907 to Gärda Lyttkens. Children: Erland born in 1908, chief engineer in Linköping, Ingvar born in 1910, chief engineer in Finspång, Bertil born in 1915, naval engineering in Karlskrona, Army Captain in 1918, aviation pilot in Norrköping. Completed bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering from Hälsingborg in 1897, and master's degree in mechanical engineering from KTH (M) in 1899-1901. Worked for several companies and traveled to the USA and other countries. Worked as an assistant engineer and bureau engineer at the Patent and Registration Office from 1901-1914, employee at A-B Diesel Engines from 1902-1903, assistant at KTH from 1903-1913, acting lecturer in machine elements from 1907-1908, acting professor in mechanical engineering in 1912, instructor in mechanics and mechanical engineering at a technical school in Stockholm from 1906-1913, and chief engineer at A-B Fören. Sv. Tändsticks-fabr. from 1913-1933. Later, he became the managing director of the same company in 1933, as well as in Jönköping & Vulcan's Match Factory A-B since 1929. He was a member of the board of directors for the aforementioned companies and for Sv. Accum. A-B Jungner, chairman of the board of directors for Sv. Vaxduks A-B and Försäkr. A-B Allni. Brand since 1946, member of the city council and city council finance committee in Kalmar from 1917-1921, chairman of the Smål. o. Blek. Chamber of Commerce since 1937. Patented several inventions, including automatic speed and distance recorders (SAL-loggen) for ships. Awarded with the Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa (KV02kl), the Order of the North Star (RNO), the Illis Quorum Medal (Idr:GM), and the Shooting Medal (SkytteGM).
